messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4648
messages.msgSnippet: We had two au pairs. One from Germany, and one from Denmark. They are NOT part-time. They are considered part of the family and live in your home for one
messages.messageBody:
"We had two au pairs. One from Germany, and one from Denmark. They are NOT
part-time. They are considered part of the family and live in your home for one

year."

A neighbor of mine worked from home. She had an Aupair that came to their house three full days a week and did not live with them. I'm sure there are differences in agencies and areas. I knew the Aupair personally, because we invited her to the neighbor "moms groups" we started. She had been looking specifically for part time, so maybe that made the difference. She was also relocating over here, don't know how that affected it all. Maybe the term "nanny" would have fit her better, but she referred to herself as an Aupair, as did her employer.??

Ren


"There is no way to
peace. Peace is the way."
~Quaker saying
